result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brent A Schulenburg

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Time of status conf on 11/22 changed by court from 8:30 to 1:30

10:57 AM Defendant Brent A Schulenburg in court, in custody.  Attorney Tess Lewangowski in court for State of Wisconsin. DE states he has applied for SPD appointment, counsel has not yet been assigned. Court finds good cause, sets status conference for 11-22-22 at 8:30am.
Status conference on November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in DCJ.  Journey Mental health sent drug court intake paperwork to court liaison for defendant to complete and returned to Journey Mental Health.

- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 12

2:43 PM Defendant Brent A Schulenburg in court, in custody.  Attorney Laura Breun in court for Brent A Schulenburg.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Olsen in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Defendant referred for screening.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.
